1:
Give thanks to Yahweh, call on his name;\q make known his deeds among the nations.
\q
2:
Sing to him, sing praises to him;\q speak of all his marvelous deeds.
\q
3:
Boast in his holy name;\q let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.


\q
4:
Seek Yahweh and his strength;\q seek his presence continually.
\q
5:
Recall the marvelous things he has done,\q his miracles and the decrees from his mouth,
\q
6:
you descendants of Abraham his servant,\q you people of Jacob, his chosen ones.


\q
7:
He is Yahweh, our God.\q His decrees are on all the earth.
\q
8:
He keeps in mind his covenant forever,\q the word that he commanded for a thousand generations.


\q
9:
He calls to mind the covenant that he made with Abraham\q and his oath to Isaac.
\q
10:
This is what he confirmed to Jacob as a statute\q and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
\q
11:
He said, "I will give you the land of Canaan\q as your share of your inheritance."


\q
12:
He said this when they were only few in number,\q so very few, and were strangers in the land.
\q
13:
They went from nation to nation\q and from one kingdom to another.


\q
14:
He did not allow anyone to oppress them;\q he rebuked kings for their sakes.
\q
15:
He said, "Do not touch my anointed ones,\q and do not harm my prophets."


\q
16:
He called for a famine on the land;\q he cut off the whole supply of bread.
\q
17:
He sent a man ahead of them;\q Joseph was sold as a servant.


\q
18:
His feet were bound by shackles;\q on his neck was put an iron collar,
\q
19:
until what he had said came to pass.\q The word of Yahweh tested him.


\q
20:
The king sent servants to release him;\q the ruler of the people set him free.
\q
21:
He put him in charge of his house\q as ruler of all his possessions
\q
22:
to instruct his princes as he wished\q and to teach his elders wisdom.
\q
23:
Then Israel came into Egypt,\q and Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham.


\q
24:
Yahweh made his people fruitful,\q and made them stronger than their enemies.
\q
25:
He caused their enemies to hate his people,\q to mistreat his servants.
\q
26:
He sent Moses, his servant,\q and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
\q
27:
They performed his signs among the Egyptians,\q his wonders in the land of Ham.


\q
28:
He sent darkness and made that land dark,\q but its people did not obey his commands.
\q
29:
He turned their water into blood\q and killed their fish.
\q
30:
Their land swarmed with frogs,\q even in the rooms of their rulers.


\q
31:
He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats came\q throughout their country.
\q
32:
He turned their rain into hail,\q with fire flaming on their land.
\q
33:
He destroyed their vines and fig trees;\q he broke the trees of their country.


\q
34:
He spoke, and the locusts came,\q so many locusts.
\q
35:
The locusts ate up all of the vegetation in their land;\q They ate up all the crops of the ground.
\q
36:
He killed every firstborn in their land,\q the firstfruits of all their strength.


\q
37:
He brought the Israelites out with silver and gold;\q none of his tribes stumbled on the way.
\q
38:
Egypt was glad when they went away,\q for the Egyptians were afraid of them.
\q
39:
He spread a cloud for a covering\q and made a fire to light up the night.


\q
40:
The Israelites asked for food, and he brought quail\q and satisfied them with bread from heaven.
\q
41:
He split the rock, and waters gushed from it;\q they flowed in the wilderness like a river.
\q
42:
For he called to mind his holy promise\q that he made to Abraham his servant.


\q
43:
He led his people out with joy,\q his chosen with shouts of triumph.
\q
44:
He gave them the lands of the nations;\q they took possession of the wealth of the peoples
\q
45:
so that they might keep his statutes\q and obey his laws.
\q Praise Yahweh.
